title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power receives approval to build Massachusetts' largest battery energy storage system at former ExxonMobil site in Everett.
The facility will occupy 16.5 acres and include 816 enclosures with lithium-ion batteries and related infrastructure.
The storage project is part of Everett's Docklands development, featuring residential, retail, manufacturing, and lab spaces.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted 'SNL' on February 28, with musical guest Mumford & Sons, following the show's post-Olympics return.
Storrie and 'Heated Rivalry' co-star Hudson Williams participated in a skating-themed sketch, introducing Mumford & Sons together.
US Olympic hockey players made monologue appearances, referencing Trump's invitation to both men's and women's teams to the State of the Union.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 1-0 to New York Red Bulls, starting 2026 season with two consecutive defeats.
Revolution defenders Brayan Ceballos and Mamadou Fofana returned, helping manage New York's pressing despite possession disparity.
Missed second-half opportunities and defensive errors prevented Revolution from capitalizing on momentum against the Red Bulls.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Triston Casas likely won't be ready for Opening Day due to recovery from a torn patellar tendon last May.
Pitchers Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval are making progress in their rehab but remain uncertain for Opening Day.
Crawford and Sandoval lack clear roles on the Red Sox roster due to offseason acquisitions and competition for spots.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to catch drivers illegally passing stopped buses.
Mayor John Vieau announced the initiative, a first in Massachusetts, aiming to enhance student safety and road security.
The cameras, activated during bus stops, capture violations for citations; no cost to the city or taxpayers.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton played a sold-out show at Mohegan Sun Arena with his eight-piece band, including his wife Morgane.
Stapleton's setlist included hits like "Tennessee Whiskey" and "Joy of My Life," with a mix of blues and ballads.
The performance featured a standout pedal steel player, Paul Franklin, and Stapleton's dynamic guitar and vocal crescendos.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: The New England Patriots may cut Stefon Diggs to save $16.8 million, despite his strong connection with QB Drake Maye.
Mack Hollins, DeMario Douglas, and Kayshon Boutte are potential cut or trade candidates due to non-guaranteed contracts saving up to $4 million.
Linebacker Christian Elliss could be released to save cap space, while center Garrett Bradbury awaits possible training camp competition.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not play in the Celtics-76ers game as he continues Achilles recovery.
Philadelphia's Joel Embiid is sidelined with an oblique strain, expected to miss three games.
Baylor Scheierman is questionable for Sunday’s game against Philadelphia due to a left thumb fracture.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hits three home runs in first week of spring training, including two against the Twins.
Duran's improved performance against left-handed pitchers is promising, having struggled against them with a .232 career average.
Duran's spring training could secure him a significant role in the Red Sox lineup, potentially as the designated hitter.

title: As 2025-26 Bruins exceed expectations, so has their prospect pool in college hockey
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins prospects James Hagens and Dean Letourneau have scored 39 goals combined this season for Boston College.
Seven Bruins draftees participated in the BC-BU hockey game, with BU winning 3-1 against BC.
Prospects like Hagens and Letourneau are revitalizing the Bruins' prospect pool with significant performances in college hockey.
